page.title: 16TRANSPORT
page.content: Transport in Borehamwood has changed over the years: there are lots more cars, buses,lorries and vans nowadays. Borehamwood has its own small bus service called the BW1 which runs about every half an hour. The local buses are owned and operated either by London Transport (red buses) or London Country (green buses). Most of the heavy lorries on local roads are connected with Christian Salvesen's cold storage depot in Elstree Way. The railway is on the line between Bedford and St. Pancras in London. It was recently modernised to overhead electrification and now 54 stopping trains travel in each direction each weekday carrying some 4000 passengers. Another 77 fast trains pass through the station in each direction daily. On Saturdays 39 stopping trains and 54 fast trains go through Borehamwood.
